courses.description:
This course is all about Autodesk Revit, the most powerful software to design buildings and civil structures. I have explained everything in a simple and practical way with a lot of examples and real-time use of the tools and facilities provided by the software.
I have use Revit 2018 to present the course but all the commands are applicable in version 2016 and 2017 as well.
Also I will make sure to add more content about the new features added to the later version as soon a they are released.

All the videos are downloadable so that you can watch them offline at your leisure.

Please let me know if you need any information and learning material in case you feel necessary, even though I have made sure all the core concepts and the most important concepts are covered.


Good luck!

courses.title: Autodesk Revit Architecture 2019 - Complete Beginner's Guide
courses.bio: Learn how to develop a simple building model in Revit, step-by-step
requirements: This is a complete beginner course so no prior experience in Revit is required.
courses.description:
What is Revit?
Revit is a BIM software used to create intelligent 3D models of buildings and production of construction documentation drawings and architectural presentations. It is not only used for architectural design and documentation but also for seamless collaboration and coordination amongst Architecture, Engineering and Construction (AEC) disciplines.
What you will Learn
In this beginner’s guide, you are going to learn the following:
Setting up a Revit Project (model)
The Revit 2019 Start Screen and Navigating around the software
Setting building levels for a single storey residential project
Drawing the walls; adding doors, windows and interior components; modelling floors, ceilings and roofs; customising the presentation styles for building elevations and floor plan
Creating a colour fill legend for room labelling and annotation.
This is a project-based course. We will be working on a single storey residential project, modelling everything from scratch as I explain the details in a simple step by step way.
Why Learn with Nzangi?
Nzangi Muimi is going to be your instructor for the course. His content delivery methodology involves step-by-step instructions. He teaches at a slow pace to allow complete beginners to follow along easily without being left out. You will love his detailed and pragmatic explanations, making seemingly complex technical concepts very easy to grasp.
target_audience: Beginner Revit users with a background in Architecture, Engineering and Construction (AEC)
Other CAD users wanting to transition to using Revit

Enroll in this course right now, and feel free to ask me any questions throughout your learning journey so you can implement this process in the best possible way. I’m with you every step of the way to help you become a professional.

courses.description:
This course provides a complete introduction to 2D and 3D drafting and design using AutoCAD software, guiding learners from fundamentals to advanced techniques. You will start by mastering the core drawing and modification tools, then progress to building complex 3D models, applying materials. As an industry expert with years of experience, I’ve designed this course to teach you everything you need to know about AutoCAD in the shortest possible time.
You’ll gain practical experience creating floor plans, elevations, circuit diagrams, mechanical parts, and structural details. You’ll also learn how to manage projects efficiently with Xrefs, Sheet Set Manager, and advanced block creation.
By the end of the course, you will be equipped with the skills to take a project from concept to professional output, whether your goal is to pursue a career in architecture, engineering, or design or to enhance your AutoCAD proficiency for certification exams and workplace advancement. The versatile skills you’ll gain in drafting, modeling, and visualization can be applied across multiple industries—including architecture, interior design, engineering, construction, manufacturing, and even product design.


Getting Started
Exploring the AutoCAD for Windows interface
Setting up drawing units and navigation basics
Understanding coordinate systems for accuracy
Basic Drawing Skills
Drawing lines, rectangles, circles, arcs, ellipses, polygons, and splines
Using drawing aids: grid, snap, ortho mode, and polar tracking

Complete a full residential building project from start to finish

Core Tools & Editing Methods
Creating selection sets for precise editing
Move, copy, rotate, scale, and array commands
Trim, extend, stretch, lengthen, offset, mirror, and align
Apply modification tools: fillet, chamfer, explode, and join
3D Modeling & Solids
Create 3D models using solids, surfaces, and meshes
Model complex 3D shapes, windows, doors, and roofs from scratch
Use solid editing tools: extrude, revolve, loft, sweep, shell, slice, subtract, and union
Apply UCS coordinates and dynamic 3D views
Set up cameras, export views, and manage rendering workflows
Customization & Efficiency
Create custom AutoCAD templates and dynamic blocks (doors, windows, furniture)
Use Layer States Manager for color profiles and theme-based work
Convert units of existing drawings with a single command
Work with Xrefs, Sheet Set Manager, and advanced annotation features
Learn AutoCAD command shortcuts to speed up workflow
Annotations, Layers & Layouts
Create and edit text using single-line, MTEXT, and custom text styles
Format, transform, and manage paragraphs of text
Work with dimensions, leaders, and annotation styles
Control object visibility and appearance through layers, linetypes, and properties
Set up layouts, viewports, page setups, and plotting for print
Configure output devices, create and use plot style tables, and export to electronic formats

courses.title: LEED AP BD+C V4 | 4 Full Practice tests | Simulation Exams
courses.bio: LEED AP BD+C Simulation exams were prepared by an approved USGBC Faculty in accordance with the GBCI LEED AP exams.
courses.description:
LEED® AP BD+C "Building Design and Construction" practice tests consist of multiple-choice questions. The students will be able to assess their knowledge and ability to finish the exam with the required score practising 400 Questions in 4 simulation exams to be completed in 2 hours each. The simulation exams are applicable for the latest version of LEED V4 and will give you a life-time access to the tests and the tests can be taken for unlimited times.
The practice questions were prepared by a USGBC approved instructor "USGBC Faculty - Karim elnabawy.  USGBC® Faculty are experienced educators with a strong background in professional education, training, and facilitation in green building and sustainability development.
Each simulation exam will allow the students to focus on the credit categories they are studying while providing explanation on correct and incorrect answers. Our simulation exams are designed to cover the whole reference guide of LEED Building design and Construction.
Benefits of our simulation exams:
You will assess your knowledge prior to the final LEED exam.
You will have access to 400 questions in 4 simulated exams that are covering the whole book.
Understand the reasoning behind each question and answer and the related knowledge area to be able to restudy or revise.
Our simulation exams are considered part of your studies as they will cover the whole LEED reference guide book.
You will become familiar with the advanced Green Building Terminologies.
You will likely most pass the exam from your first attempt.
You can directly contact the course provider for any questions that require more clarification, and he will reply as soon as he can.
The LEED simulation exams are designed same as the final exam. The LEED AP Exams assesses candidates’ abilities at three hierarchical cognitive levels: Recall, Application and Analysis.
• Recall Items: These items assess a candidate’s ability to recall factual material that is presented in a similar context to the exam references.
• Application Items: These items provide the candidate with a novel problem or scenario that the candidate can solve using familiar principles or procedures described in the exam references.
• Analysis Items: These items assess a candidate’s ability to break the problem down into its components to create a solution. The candidate must not only recognize the different elements of the problem, but must also evaluate the relationship or interactions of these elements.
Our exams are prepared in accordance with LEED requirement and score allocation for actual tests :
LEED Process (8 Questions)
Integrative Strategies (9 Questions)
Location and Transportation (9 Questions)
Sustainable Sites (9 Questions)
Water Efficiency (9 Questions)
Energy and Atmosphere (14 Questions)
Materials and Resources (12 Questions)
Indoor Environmental Quality (11 Questions)
Project Surroundings and Public Outreach (4 Questions)
The exam contains (15 unscored questions) - In our simulation exams, we will distribute the 15 unscored questions among the other 9 knowledge areas.
Get ready to test your green building skills and enroll now!
General notes:
The simulation exams are provided by karim elnabawy - GBERA "Green Building Education and Research Academy" and it took a huge amount of time and effort to be developed in a way that will allow students benefit from them. The simulation exams are not allowed to be distributed outside Udemy by any means. Only sharing the official link to the course is allowed.
Screenshots are not allowed.
The simulation exams are not related officially by any means to USGBC or GBCI education programs.
In the following link, you will understand how to use UDEMY practice tests: https://support.udemy.com/hc/en-us/articles/231954647-Practice-Test-FAQs
GBERA is not affiliated with the U.S. Green Building Council®  or Green Business Certification Inc.™ and does not administer the LEED AP® /LEED®  Green Associate™ program. USGBC and GBCI do not endorse or recommend the products or services offered by GBERA.

LEED® Green Associate™ and the LEED Green Associate logos are trademarks owned by the U.S. Green Building Council® and are used with permission.

requirements: Basic knowledge of Revit
courses.description:
Course Description:
The demand for more efficient and higher-quality designs in construction projects has pushed the need for advanced tools to optimize time, resources, and outcomes. This course focuses on Generative Design, one of the most exciting applications of computational design. By learning to apply optimization algorithms, you will be able to generate thousands of potential design solutions based on defined rules and parameters, resulting in optimal outcomes even for the most complex projects.
Through this course, you will master the principles of Generative Design and its practical applications, helping you improve design efficiency and provide better solutions for your clients. You'll also discover how computational design can enhance your team's competitiveness and enable you to tackle new challenges in the construction industry.
By the end of this course, you'll be equipped with the knowledge to implement Generative Design in your organization and take full advantage of the innovation it offers in design and project evaluation.
Course Content:
Introduction to Generative Design
Lecture 1: Welcome
Lecture 2: Introduction to Generative Design
Lecture 3: Computational Design – Understanding the foundations
Lecture 4: Generative Design – How it works and why it’s essential
Lecture 5: Stages and Steps of Generative Design – Breaking down the process
Generative Design in Practice
Lecture 6: Example of Generative Design – MaRs Innovations District case study
Lecture 7: What is an Algorithm? – Understanding the backbone of design optimization
Lecture 8: Options Engineering – Exploring the range of possible solutions
Lecture 9: Optimization – Techniques to improve design efficiency
Lecture 10: Genetic Algorithms – How nature-inspired processes help in design
Lecture 11: Visual Programming – The role of visual interfaces in design
Lecture 12: Introduction to Dynamo – A visual programming tool for designers
Lecture 13: User Interface – How to interact with design software
Lecture 14: Hello World in Dynamo – A beginner's guide to creating your first script
Lecture 15: Data Types – Understanding the basics of data in design
Lecture 16: Lists – Using lists to organize and manipulate data
Advanced Generative Design Applications
Lecture 17: Revit Elements – Integrating generative design with Revit
Lecture 18: Generative Design Tool in Revit – How to access and use this tool
Lecture 19: Creation of a Generative Design Study – Setting up a project from scratch
Lecture 20: Simple Case – Highest Point of a Surface
Lecture 21: Simple Case – Minimum Volume and Maximum Surface Area
Lecture 22: Building Massing Generator – A tool for creating building forms
Lecture 23: Positioning Buildings According to Solar Incidence – Optimizing energy efficiency
Lecture 24: Optimized Office Space Planning – Designing efficient office layouts
Lecture 25: Placement of Objects in a Grid – Creating organized structures
Lecture 26: Random Object Placement – Applying randomness to design elements
Lecture 27: Distribution of Luminaires – Optimizing lighting placement
Lecture 28: Placement of Views on Sheets – Organizing design plans
Implementing Generative Design in Architecture and Engineering Firms
Lecture 29: Generative Design in Organizations – How to integrate it into your workflow
Lecture 30: Next Steps – Advancing your generative design skills and continuing your journey
Who is this course for?
Architects, engineers, and construction professionals looking to optimize design processes.
Designers interested in computational design and its applications in construction.
Anyone looking to understand how Generative Design can revolutionize project planning, evaluation, and execution.
Why take this course?
Learn cutting-edge design techniques that optimize both time and resources.
Master the use of optimization algorithms to generate thousands of design alternatives.
Apply Generative Design tools in Revit, Dynamo, and other software used in the construction industry.
Implement these tools within your company to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and create better designs.
Course Outcome:
By completing this course, you'll gain the ability to use Generative Design to address complex design challenges, provide innovative solutions for clients, and increase the competitiveness of your design team. You'll also be prepared to apply these techniques within your organization for better, faster project results.
Enroll now to begin mastering Generative Design and take your design skills to the next level.
target_audience: Professionals and students of architecture and engineering careers

Learn how to model a building from scratch using Autodesk Revit. If you are a complete beginner user, this course will help you develop your skills and knowledge in creating and managing Revit models.
You will develop a strong understanding of the software's interface, tools, and functionalities, enabling you to efficiently navigate and utilize Revit for various architectural, engineering, and construction projects.
Starting out with the basic concepts of BIM working within the 3D environment of Revit, we will start with setting out the building constraints, before working through the different modelling, annotation and documentation tools available within Revit.
This course  introduces learner to new, more advanced topics, continuously improving the skillset to ensure you make full use of all the available tools, workflows and tips.
Engaging with a diverse range of real-world examples can significantly deepen your understanding of complex concepts. By applying this knowledge to practical situations, you can identify specific areas where you need improvement. This  not only reinforces learning but also helps you develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills, making the learning experience more relevant and impactful.
These outcomes and skills will enable you to confidently apply your knowledge of Autodesk Revit across various Projects, enhancing your professional capabilities and career prospects.


Feel Free to Ask your Doubts, I will try to solve them asap!!
Best Of Luck !! Happy Learning !!

courses.title: Fundamentals of Concrete Technology
courses.bio: Condensed guide on the properties of concrete to push your engineering skill set to the next level
objectives: How concrete is made and it's components
The heat of hydration
Properties of fresh and hardened concrete
Workability, settlement, bleeding and plastic shrinkage
requirements: None
courses.description:
By the end of this course, you will fully grasp the theory behind the production of concrete from chemical compound, all the way to quality hardened concrete.
We’re not going to worry about the design of concrete elements in this course, but instead take a deep dive into fundamental concrete properties and behaviour as the concrete sets on site.
Please Note this course covers the properties of concrete and not the design of reinforced concrete elements.
I have designed this course for engineers early in their career that are looking to take their knowledge of concrete to the next level, but don’t have the time to sift through textbooks looking for the relevant facts, or are struggling to get enough actual site time while being stuck in the office all day.
The main items we'll focus on in this course are:
Cementitious materials
The hydration process
The influence of admixtures and aggregates
Properties of fresh and hardened concrete
Workability, settlement, bleeding and plastic shrinkage
Tensile and core strength
We'll focus not only on the theory, but also real world considerations that are not often found in the text books.
This course has been specifically designed to give value to you, the student, and lifetime access means you will receive all future updates and additions free of charge.
If you are not 100% sure this course is for you, feel free to take a look around. If you are not convinced, there is a 30 day money back guarantee with no hard feelings or questions asked.
Thanks for taking the time to view this course, and I hope to see you in there!
target_audience: Structural engineers looking to increase or refresh their knowledge

courses.title: Create & Design a Modern Architecture House in Blender 3D
courses.bio: Learn How to Model a 3D Photo Realistic Architectural Render Using Blender! 4.2+ Compatible
objectives: Model a modern 3D house in Blender using reference images and precise dimensions.
Apply realistic materials, textures, and lighting for photorealistic renders.
Use particle systems, HDR lighting, and assets to enhance architecture scenes.
Start a big Blender project and learn the process of how to completing it.
Bonus: Create a tree, bed, and couch with cloth simulation and sculpting.

Adding in the Models: Adding Models to the First Floor
Adding Models to the Second Floor
Rendering, Compositing and Final Tweaks: How to Create a Clay Render
Creating the Modern Bed & Pillows: Creating Pillows with Ease in Blender

requirements: Students need to have Blender installed on their computer.
It is recommended that you have a 3-button mouse
Prior knowledge about Blender is helpful but not required
courses.description:
Do you want to learn how to create stunning photorealistic 3D architectural renders in Blender? Do you want to be able to digitally recreate your own house in Blender? By the end of this course you will have made a beautiful 3D modern house. The first section of this course will be focused on modeling our modern house. Over the next couple sections we will be adding materials, textures, modeling and lighting to our scene. I will then show you how to render your image and post process it.
There are a couple bonus videos as well! The first 2 are: How to Create a Clay Version of your Render and how to use the Workbench Engine! After that we jump into the real-time render engine Eevee and learn setup our scene using this engine in Blender!
Learning Blender can be very hard when you first start that's why I built this course for all levels beginner to advanced. I will be showing you step by step on what to do and why we do it. From the basics of modeling to advanced techniques like creating grass with particle systems.
I have also included 3 bonus sections in this course. The first one is creating a realistic tree in Blender. We will go through how to create an organic looking tree, apply textures and use particle systems to create the branches.
The second bonus section is about creating a modern bed! We will learn all about the cloth simulation and how to easily create pillows using it! After that we learn about creating a procedural fabric material!
Finally the last tutorial I will show you how to create a modern couch in Blender. First thing we will do is model and sculpt it. This will add some creases to make it more realistic. Then, of course, the materials and rendering.
I will be giving away 15 professionally made models and 5 high resolution textures. You are free to use these models for other scenes but you are not allowed to sell or upload them. By enrolling in this course you agree those conditions.
What you’ll learn
Create their own architectural renders using Blender
Texture and make realistic materials for their own scenes.
Work comfortably in Blender
Are there any class requirements or prerequisites?
Students need to have Blender installed on their computer.
It is recommended that you have a computer mouse.
Prior knowledge about Blender will be useful but not required.
Who this course is for:
Anyone who wants to learn about Blender, 3d, architectural rendering, or photorealism.
We will be using the following programs in this course.
Programs Used in this Class:
Blender 3D
I hope you are excited to jump into this course! And I can't wait to see your amazing renders!
Thanks
Stephen
target_audience: Beginners who want to learn architectural visualization in Blender.
3D artists aiming to add realistic houses and interiors to their portfolio.
Students interested in modeling, texturing, and rendering modern designs.
Hobbyists or professionals wanting step-by-step projects to sharpen their Blender skills.

courses.title: Art of Architectural Aesthetics:Symmetry, Balance and Beyond
courses.bio: Rhythm and Pattern, Balance and Pattern, Hierarchy and Focal Points
objectives: Gain an understanding of the aesthetic principles that underpin architectural design, with a focus on symmetry, balance, rhythm, hierarchy, pattern, axis etc.
Develop practical skills to integrate aesthetic components into architectural designs, fostering visual harmony and user engagement.
Explore the historical evolution of architectural aesthetics and examine how contemporary designers continue to push the boundaries of visual expression.
Examine and analyze real-world examples of architectural masterpieces
Investigate how innovation and sustainability intersect with architectural aesthetics, shaping the future of design.

WELCOME AND INTRODUCTION TO THE COURSE: WELCOME AND INTRODUCTION TO THE COURSE
Introduction to Architectural Aesthetics: Greeks And Romans Perspectives On Aesthetics In Building Design
Perspectives On Aesthetics During Byzantine And Islamic Period
Perspectives On Aesthetics During Romanesque And Gothic Period
Exploring Proportion and Scale in Archit: Exploring Proportion and Scale in Architecture
Creating Visual Rhythm in Building Desig: Creating Visual Rhythm in Building Design
Conclusion and List of Further Reading M: Conclusion and List of Further Reading Materials

requirements: This course is suitable for individuals with a background or interest in architecture, design, or related fields.
While no formal prerequisites are required, a basic familiarity with architectural concepts and terminology would be beneficial.
courses.description:
The aesthetics of a building is one of the principal aspects considered in architecture. The appeal of a building covers the combined effects of a building's shape, size, texture, colour, balance, unity, movement, emphasis, contrast, symmetry, proportion, space, alignment, pattern, decoration, culture and context.
"The Art of Architectural Aesthetics," is a comprehensive course that delves into the principles of symmetry, balance, and other essential elements that shape the visual harmony of architectural design. This course is designed for architects, designers, and enthusiasts eager to deepen their understanding of the aesthetic components that contribute to the beauty and functionality of built environments.
As we embark on this journey through "The Art of Architectural Aesthetics," you will not only gain a profound understanding of the principles that govern design but also acquire the skills to apply them in real-world scenarios. Whether you are a seasoned architect or someone with a budding interest in design, this course invites you to explore the captivating realm where symmetry, balance, and beyond converge to create spaces that resonate with beauty and purpose. This course aims to provide participants with a solid foundation in architectural aesthetics and equip them with the skills to create aesthetically pleasing and functional designs.
This course is suitable for individuals with a background or interest in architecture, design, or related fields. While no formal prerequisites are required, a basic familiarity with architectural concepts and terminology would be beneficial.
target_audience: Architects and Designers who wish to Enhance their design skills and discover new approaches to elevate their projects.
Professionals in Related Fields of construction, urban planning, or real estate
Enthusiasts and Hobbyists who wish to deepen their appreciation for architecture and gain a new perspective on the visual language of built environments.

courses.description:
LibreCAD
LibreCAD is  a CAD software. It is free. It allows you to create 2D drawings such as plans or technical drawings. Many features make it possible to work efficiently on 2D drawing. It is possible to create projects with cuts, dimensions, colors. Then, this work is introduced on a page template. It can also be printed. If you need a free tool to make technical drawings, then this software will be suitable. Working with layers, create blocks, master tools, add dimensions. You can let your ideas express themselves with LibreCAD. Create your 2D projects, then have an important step in the creation of a project. LibreCAD supports a wide range of file formats.


Why to use LibreCAD ?
- Free software
- Work on the creation part of a project
- Create technical drawings
- Create plans
- Many design tools
- Ergonomic features
- Work with layers
- Add dimensions
- Create blocks
- Introduce drawing on page


Training course
In this training, you will learn how to use LibreCAD to create your design projects. Getting started with the dashboard and navigation. You will see how to use the design tools with concrete examples. You will learn how to use the transformation features to be able to edit the drawings. You will see how to use layers and create blocks. Use the grid and the all the features . You will see how to present your drawings on pages. At the end of the training, projects will allow you to apply the functionalities seen in the course.

Peope who want free CAD software
People who want to create 2D plans
People who want to introduce drawings

requirements: AutoCad 2013 to 2023 All Applicable.
A PC or Laptop with preferably Windows 7/10/11. Mac is similar, but not the same.
courses.description: Welcome!  My name is Joe McGovern and I'm a high school teacher of Architecture, Engineering and Design.  I am also a project manager at a local Architecture firm.  In this beginner to advanced 2D course, I will start off by showing you how to easily navigate the User Interface.  This includes use of the command line, 3 coordinate systems of input, tool location, shortcuts, tips and tricks.  The following tools will be extensively reviewed throughout the course; Line, Polyline, Rectangle, Circle, Move, Copy, Trim, Extend, Dimensioning, DDIM, Stretch, Rotate, Mirror, Array, Offset, Fillet, Chamfer, Line Colors, Line Weights, Line Types, use of Layers and many more!  You will build the skills necessary to accurately depict 2D plans in this beginner to advanced order; Title Block, Line Types, Triangle Summary, Inlaid Linoleum (4-44), Field, Pacman, Fireplace, Door & Window, Furniture and iPhone.  I will not only show you how to draw these assignments, but I will teach you my work flow, my thought process and all the tips and tricks I've learned over the 20 years I've been studying Architecture and AutoCAD.  Join my course and follow along to take your 2D AutoCAD skills from the Beginner to Advanced level.  Thank you and enjoy the course!
target_audience: Brushing Up Your Skills in AutoCAD.

courses.title: Rhino 3D Modelling + Lumion 9.5 Photorealistic Rendering
courses.bio: Fast track course to create a 3D model and render an architectural/design stunning image.
objectives: Students will learn how to model in 2D and 3D, managing Rhinoceros program in a fast track course method, which emphasizes in learning the essentials of Rhino in order to portray what you have in mind, directly being able to construct a three-dimensional model in the most precise, detailed and rigorous manner. I have been teaching Rhino 2D and 3D modelling to students and architecture professionals in a fast track course method which will grant students the techniques, methods, and abilities to master the essentials of Rhinoceros within a few hours.

You will be able to create freeform shapes mastering the techniques of curves, surfaces and meshes to optimize 3D modelling. This course will not only teach you the essentials of 3D modelling, but includes features that allows simple, concise and effective techniques for 2d drawings and drafs, in order to develop technical illustrations.

Students will learn how to use Lumion 9.5 in order to render 3D models that have been produced in Rhino, being able to develop a realistic architectural/design model, which includes the features of render materials, illumination, interior and exterior furnishing, and landscape techniques. You will be able to produce very realistic renders in a fast-track course method
requirements: There are initial requirements for this course.
courses.description:
The "Rhino 3D Modelling + Lumion 9.5 Rendering" course covers the essentials and complete structure of 3D modeling with Rhinoceros program in order to learn how to model in 3D, and the essentials in order to render a stunning image in Lumion. This course is designed to guide students with zero or low familiarity of 3D modelling in rhino to an advanced level in the technique of modeling in just a matter of hours. After having designed a 3D model, you will learn in a fast track course technique how to render stunning images. This course will guide you through four main categories which will assure your complete understanding of Rhino modelling + Lumion rendering:
1. Introduction: This section will show you a precise overview of how the course is organized (sections and sub sections), what you will be learning, and getting to know your instructor.
2. Becoming Familiar with Rhino: This section will ensure a complete understanding of Rhino's main default menu, which includes many tab configurations, side bars and panels, viewports, properties, etc... The idea is to give an overview of how the Rhinoceros program organizes all of it's functions and commands in order to give the user knowledge and a complete understanding of all the potentials that Rhino has in relation to the upcoming technologies.
3. Modelling a house - 2D and 3D construction: This section will go through the process of modelling a house in 2D and 3D, with all of the key elements that an architectural construction requires; by these means, these include: Foundations, plinth beams, subfloor concrete and ground levels, inner and outer walls, access points, beams, slabs, ceilings, roofs, windows openings and exterior features. At the end of this section, the user will have a complete understanding of the different techniques and methods in order to model a house from scratch.
4. Interface from Rhino to Lumion: This section will show the necesarry information in order to transfer all of the information from a 3D model to a render.
5. Becoming Familiar with Lumion: This section will go through a complete overview of Lumion's main default menu, options, tabs, settings and properties in order to manage all of the programs functions.
6. Rendering a house: This section will emphasize in teaching the user which are the most precise, acurate, rigorous and interesting ways in order to introduce Materials, illumination techniques, inner and outer furnishing and lanscaping to your 3D model. This section will emphasize in learning different procedures in order to develop a realistic and stunning architectural model.
target_audience: Students will learn how to manage the potential of Rhinoceros 3D modelling and Lumion rendering, using a wide range of modelling rendering techniques, meaning that there are a wide range of target students which include architecture designers, product designers, structural designers and furniture and fashion designers.

This course grants different techniques, abilities, methods and courses of action, in which students with wide ranges of backgrounds will take advantage of the proficiency and skillfulness that is given throughout this course.

This comprehensive course is tailored to equip learners with the fundamental and advanced skills needed to master 3D modeling using AutoCAD's latest version. Whether you're a budding designer, an engineering professional, or an enthusiast looking to expand your CAD expertise, this training is your gateway to creating exceptional mechanical designs and realizing complex technical ideas effectively.
Throughout the course, you'll explore the powerful features of AutoCAD 2025 and learn to navigate its interface with confidence. Have you ever felt overwhelmed creating professional architectural sheets in Revit?
Do you want to master the full documentation workflow — from technical drawings to sheet layout and construction detailing?
Would you like to present your architectural and BIM projects with confidence, clarity, and professional standards?


This course is your complete guide to architectural documentation and detailing in Revit 2025. Whether you're a beginner trying to break into the world of technical drawing or a designer aiming to level up your documentation skills, this course will give you the knowledge and practical tools to create real, construction-ready outputs.
Course Overview:
In the first part of the course, you’ll learn the core concepts of professional drafting and sheet setup in Revit — from creating precise views and legends to organizing layouts and managing title blocks effectively.
Next, we’ll focus on construction detailing: how to create accurate 2D and 3D details, annotate them correctly, and manage detail views within real project sheets. You’ll work with real-world project examples, including walls, sections, joints, and key construction components.
Finally, you'll discover how to streamline your documentation workflow, apply best practices for construction-ready sets, and make your presentation sheets stand out.
What You Will Learn:
Creating technical drawings and documentation sets in Revit 2025
Organizing and laying out architectural sheets with a professional touch
Drafting detail drawings with full annotation, dimensions, and material tags
Managing views, view templates, and sheet standards
Creating 2D & 3D construction details using real-world components
Preparing your Revit model for printing, exporting, and client submission
Tips and tricks to present your work like a pro using Revit’s built-in tools
By the end of this course, you'll be able to produce clean, professional architectural sheets that follow construction documentation standards, ready for real-world projects or your portfolio. You’ll also gain critical Revit skills that are in high demand in architectural offices, BIM consultancies, and construction firms.
If you enroll in this course, I’ll be here to answer your questions and support your learning journey from start to finish!

courses.title: iGenius: Be Creative with Artificial Intelligence (AI)
courses.bio: Discover your inner Da Vinci through Artificial Intelligence (AI)
objectives: Tap into your intuitive creative potential through structured but playful exercises.
Use the Word–Sign–Shape–AI method to build visionary design concepts.
Develop sketching techniques that reveal emotion, movement, and meaning.
Transform everyday observations into design inspirations.
Apply AI tools (like Veras, Photoshop, Runway) to visualize and animate your concepts.
Design across multiple disciplines—from architecture to furniture to pastry—with clarity and originality.
Build a meaningful portfolio that reflects your personal design language.
requirements: No previous experience is required. Access to VERAS and Runway apps is required.
courses.description:
We often think that creativity is something reserved for a few. The truth is—it’s in all of us. But somewhere along the way, between deadlines, doubt, and rules, we stop listening to it. This course is an invitation to remember.
I-Genius is not about mastering a tool. It’s about shifting how you see the world—and how you see yourself as a creator. It’s about learning to trust your instincts, play with ideas, and transform what’s inside you into something that speaks to the outside world.
Led by architect, designer, and educator Moshe Katz, this course combines intuitive sketching, storytelling, and hands-on exercises with the power of artificial intelligence. You’ll learn how to generate visionary ideas and use Artificial Intelligence (AI) not as a replacement, but as a partner in your process—one that supports and expands your imagination.
From abstract words to sketches, from shapes to AI-generated visuals, from object design to emotional storytelling—you’ll learn to bring ideas to life that feel deeply yours. You’ll build concepts rooted in memory, feeling, and intention—and turn them into images, objects, or experiences that surprise even you.
Whether you’re designing a sculpture, a building, a pastry, or something entirely new, this course will show you that you don’t need to follow a trend to be original. You just need to follow your curiosity.
And in a time when AI is everywhere, this course gives you the most powerful creative advantage: the ability to stay human, while designing what hasn’t been imagined yet.
I invite all students to ask questions or submit their work here, and I will be happy to provide inspirational feedback and engage one-on-one with each of you to help you bring it one step further and uncover your hidden potential.
target_audience: The course is for educators, art teachers, parents and anyone interested in creative education and expanding their creative potential through AI.

Do you know what features a suitable template provides for a modeler?
Are you aware of the advantages of using a suitable template?
Do you know how templates used for each project are created?
Revit is an advanced software for designing and modeling buildings, developed by Autodesk. This software supports Building Information Modeling (BIM), enabling designers and engineers to work cohesively throughout the construction process and the lifespan of a project.
The use of templates in Revit is crucial; templates are patterns that include default settings for projects. By utilizing templates, you can easily apply the necessary initial settings and configurations for each project, thereby accelerating the design and modeling process and reducing errors.

Standard Settings for BIM Projects
Annotations Types

objectives: Navigating the AutoCAD Interface: Become familiar with AutoCAD’s workspace, toolbars, and shortcuts to navigate the software efficiently.

courses.description:
Welcome to "AutoCAD Mastery: Design, Draft, and Create Like a Pro" — your ultimate guide to mastering one of the most powerful design and drafting tools used by professionals worldwide.
Whether you're a beginner just starting or looking to refine your skills, this course is designed to take you through the entire AutoCAD experience. objectives: To gain an understanding of the fundamental design aspects of building acoustics and noise control

requirements: High school mathematics and physics knowledge an advantage but not essential.
courses.description:
This course is aimed at anyone considering entering the acoustic consultancy profession including university students, engineering and architectural professionals looking for a career change or construction industry contractors. It provides the fundamental knowledge to understand the key design aspects of building acoustics and noise control. It is considered to be entry level acoustics knowledge for all engineering students wanting to get a job in the acoustic industry. High school mathematics is preferred but not essential.
To demonstrate the concepts, example spreadsheet calculations and sound demonstrations (called auralisations) are provided. Spreadsheets are also available as separate downloads.
Topics covered include acoustic fundamentals, sound outdoors, room acoustics, sound insulation, impact noise, acoustics for sustainable design.
By the end of this course students with an undergraduate degree in engineering, science or architecture, as well as mature age students with previous work experience from the building and construction industry will have enough background knowledge to qualify for entry level acoustic consultant job positions.
Course content in detail:
1. Acoustic Fundamentals
a. What is sound?
b. Decibel arithmetic
c. Describing sound sources
d. Acoustic properties of materials
e. More detail on sound absorption


2. Sound Propagation Outdoors
a. Describing sound sources
b. 5 factors affecting direct sound levels (in detail)
c. Distance from the source
d. Sound source size
e. Source directivity and location
f. Screening by barriers
g. Calculations of outdoor sound levels
h. Outdoor sound level criteria


3. Room Acoustics
a. Sound propagation in rooms
b. Types of surfaces
c. Reverberation time calculations
d. Reverberant sound level calculations
e. Room acoustic modelling
f. 3D room acoustic modelling software
g. Auralisations
h. Auralisation example (Beijing Watercube)


4. Sound Insulation
a. Sound absorption and sound insulation
b. Airborne and structureborne sound
c. Sound insulation performance parameters
d. Sound Insulation of partitions
e. Sound Insulation of glazing
f. Sound Insulation of composite partitions
g. Sound Insulating constructions
h. Auralisations of sound insulation


5. Impact Noise
a. Sound transmission in buildings
b. Impact noise generation and transmission through structures
c. Impact noise parameters and standards
d. Impact noise measurements
e. Sound insulating floor systems
f. Impact noise reduction
g. Case study – residential apartment


6. Acoustics for Sustainable Design
a. Acoustic considerations for sustainable design (city and building scale)
b. Acoustic comfort in green building rating systems (1hr to end of here)
c. Acoustics for open plan offices
d. Acoustic privacy in meeting rooms and offices
e. Natural ventilation and noise control
f. Dual vented window design
g. Naturally ventilated design of a library
h. Recycled materials with acoustic properties
i. Daylighting and acoustics


I also have a starting course called Acoustics for Beginners if you want to start with the basics of acoustics before progressing to this course.
Feel free to also check out my other course focusing on Heating Ventilation and Airconditioning and Noise Control.
target_audience: Advanced high school and university students.

2D and 3D Visualization with Adobe Illustrator: Specialized Training for Architecture, Landscape and Urban Planning is a comprehensive training program that will take your design and visualization skills to the next level. This course is designed specifically for students of architecture, landscape, and urban planning and will allow you to learn 2D and 3D visualization techniques through the powerful tools and functions Adobe Illustrator offers.


Throughout the course, you'll learn the Adobe Illustrator interface, tools, and functions, and work on techniques for creating, editing, and stylizing 2D and 3D images. courses.title: Wellness & Sustainability
courses.bio: Design with Purpose and Impact
objectives: Understand the relationship between wellness, sustainability, and design
Identify and incorporate natural elements such as light, materials, and outdoor spaces

requirements: This course is open to anyone with a passion for design, wellness, or sustainability—no formal background required. All you need is curiosity and a willingness to explore how thoughtful design can positively impact people and the planet.
courses.description:
In today’s fast-paced world, the spaces we inhabit have a profound impact on our health, mindset, and connection to the environment. Design for Wellness and Sustainability is a transformative course that explores how thoughtful, human-centered design can create spaces that are not only beautiful and functional—but also nurturing, ethical, and environmentally responsible.
Led by architect Branka Knezevic, founder of Plana Architects, this course dives into the intersection of wellness and sustainability across various design disciplines, including architecture, interior design, urban planning, and beyond. You’ll learn how to incorporate natural light, materials, ventilation, and outdoor engagement into your projects, while also understanding how spatial design influences human behavior, emotion, and community well-being.
Beyond green checklists and certifications, this course is about designing with soul. You’ll examine the deeper purpose behind spaces—from cultural sensitivity and inclusivity to ethical responsibility and community resilience. Real-world examples and case studies from around the globe will inspire you to create environments that support both people and the planet.
Topics covered include:
Core concepts of wellness and sustainability
Biophilic design and natural elements
The psychology of space and spatial sequencing
Cultural and social context in design
Ethical decision-making and people-centered approaches
Using design as a tool for education and empowerment
This course is perfect for designers, architects, students, creatives, and curious minds looking to integrate purpose, empathy, and sustainability into their design process. No formal training is required—just a passion for shaping better spaces and a better future.
By the end of this course, you’ll have a holistic framework and practical insights to help you design spaces that not only look good—but feel good, do good, and stand the test of time.
target_audience: Architects, designers, creatives, and anyone passionate about wellness, sustainability, or socially responsible design. Whether you're a student, emerging professional, or simply curious about how spaces can support human and environmental well-being, this course will give you the tools and inspiration to design with purpose. courses.description:
About the Instructor
I am a professional Engineer with degree in Transportation Engineering. Working in a multinational Consultancy Firm as a Senior Highway Design Engineer. I have been a part of many Mega projects of National and International Importance.
As a Highway Design Engineer, AutoCAD Civil 3D is my primary design tool. I have excellently developed my skills on AutoCAD Civil 3D over a period of many years, working on several Highway Design projects.
Key Features of This Course
One of the most comprehensive AutoCAD Civil 3D online course on Pipe Network Design.
Video lectures for your extensive learning.
All lesson files included for download.
Taught by a Professional Engineer having extensive hands-on experience of AutoCAD Civil 3D.
Course is based on a real life example Residential Land Development Project.
Project-oriented Course
The course lessons are project-oriented and all of the tools and commands are taught with their real-world applications. As you work your way through this course, you are going to take a journey through the completion of a residential land development project from start to finish. The topics are presented as though you have never touched a CAD program before. Whatever you learn and practice in this course will be relevant to the real life practices.
Which version of AutoCAD Civil 3D is used?
I have used AutoCAD Civil 3D 2018 for recording this course but it is equally good for AutoCAD Civil 3D 2015 and later versions. But it is recommended that you have at least installed AutoCAD Civil 3D 2016 on your computer as the practice files are compatible with AutoCAD Civil 3D 2016 and higher versions.
What Topics are Covered in This Course?
This course is organized to provide you with the knowledge needed to master the essentials of AutoCAD Civil 3D. This course is divided into three (03) chapters/sections and a total of ten (10) lectures as described below:
Section 1: Designing Gravity Pipe Networks Demonstrates how to design underground gravity pipe systems for a residential land development project while focusing on the pipe network functions of AutoCAD Civil 3D. This Section covers creating and editing pipe networks.
Section 2: Designing Pressure Pipe Networks Demonstrates how to design underground pressure pipe systems for a residential land development project while focusing on the pressure pipe network functions of AutoCAD Civil 3D. This Section covers creating and editing pressure pipe networks.
Section 3: Displaying and Annotating Pipe Networks Demonstrates how to control the appearance of pipe networks (both gravity and pressure) and provide annotation while focusing on AutoCAD Civil 3D pipe styles, structure styles, fitting styles, appurtenance styles, and pipe network labels. This Section covers displaying pipe networks in profile view, creating pipe network labels, and creating pipe network tables.
The course is easy to follow; all of the resources needed are posted in the course content. What are you waiting for....! Register Now.
Instructor support for questions
I understand that students will have questions related to the course and it is necessary also for a healthy learning process hence I encourage students to ask their questions related to the course in the Q&A section of the course. I answer each and every question as soon as possible on Udemy Q&A section.

Civil Engineers, Transportation Engineers, City and Regional Planners, Land Developers, Surveyors, etc.
High-school students following a design-related educational track
College students learning to be designers or engineers
Employees who have joined a company that utilizes Civil 3D
Employees who work for companies that have recently implemented Civil 3D
Experienced Civil 3D users who are self-taught and who want to fill in gaps in their knowledge base

courses.title: Futuristic and Visionary Architecture
courses.bio: Translating Light, Silence, and Infinity into Space
objectives: Define what makes architecture spiritual and how to approach design beyond function
Explore how light, void, and form can act as materials of spiritual expression
Translate spiritual concepts like infinity, harmony, and unity into architectural language
Develop your design through intuition, story, abstraction, and poetic symbolism
Plan spaces as spiritual journeys designing sequences, frames, and sacred passages

requirements: No requirements.
courses.description:
How do you design and capture the spirit of the place? In a world driven by speed, surface, and distraction, we are starved for depth. As cities expand and buildings multiply, what’s often missing is the soul, spaces that heal, inspire, and connect us to something greater. Futuristic and Visionary Architecture is a call to return to the essential.
Led by visionary architect Moshe Katz, this course invites you to reimagine architecture not as a container of life but as a living being that breathes, remembers, and reveals. You’ll learn to see space as sacred, materials as carriers of memory, and light as more than illumination but as meaning.
Through a blend of philosophy, design exploration, and visual poetics, Katz guides you to work not only with function and form but with stillness, intuition, ritual, and the unseen. From Japanese shrines and silent thresholds to the curves of a dome or the emptiness of a void, you’ll explore how architecture can elevate the everyday experience into a spiritual act.
This is not just a course in design. It’s a futuristic transformation of how we think, feel, and build. Whether you’re an architect, artist, student, or seeker, this course gives you tools to create with more presence, more poetry, and purpose.
Now, more than ever, the world needs spaces that remind us of who we are and what we belong to. This course is a starting point for the new approach to architecture that will make you a visionary and transform your projects into something completely new.
I invite all students to ask questions or submit their work here, and I will be happy to provide inspirational feedback and engage one-on-one with each of you to help you bring it one step further and uncover your hidden potential.

4-Special Effects Photoshop can also be used to also add colour, finishes and effects to your visuals.  The images above show how a basic line drawing can be re
requirements: no experience required
courses.description:
In this class, you’ll learn how improve your presentations with the help of photoshop. This class is great for anyone, whether you’re a homeowner looking to freshen up a space or an interior design looking to practice your skills.
Even if you prefer to draw your visuals by hand, Photoshop can still be useful. For instance, if you’ve created and rendered your own perspective drawings without using CAD software, you can use Photoshop to accentuate and enhance your visuals. You can add lighting effects to give an idea of depth, tone and shade.
These skills can be applied to different disciplines within a design context, from garden designs to retail concepts.
Using the same tools and techniques, you can render planting plans, garden plans, and even store fronts and product displays.
These steps are ordered in such a way as to get you creating the best images in the fastest time possible. If you were looking to do this professionally or churn out really high end images, I would shuffle some of these steps around and put a higher priority on 3D model texture and render settings.
The barrier to entry for Photoshop is much less than that of render software. You can iterate and experiment at a much faster rate which is crucial to successful viz. With rendering software, it is too easy to get sucked into the endless search for perfect render settings and waiting hours for images to kick out.

courses.title: EV Thermal Management: Keeping Vehicles Cool & Efficient
courses.bio: Learn key thermal architectures for performance and safety
objectives: what is thermal management
components needed for thermal management
Cooling circuit architectures

Introduction to EV Thermal Management: What is Thermal management and why it is important?

Individual loops - Idling condition with AC switched off
Integrated Thermal Management Architectu: Intro to Integrated Thermal Management architecture
Integrated Thermal Management architecture- Sub zero conditions
Comparison of Individual loops and Integrated Thermal Management architecture
Study the latest Tesla Model 3 thermal architecture

requirements: Electric vehicle knolwedge
courses.description:
Are you curious about how vehicles stay cool and efficient even under tough conditions? Whether it’s a traditional car or an electric vehicle, managing heat is key to making them safer, longer-lasting, and better performing. This course will take you on a clear, step-by-step journey into the fascinating world of thermal management—without confusing technical jargon.
Divided into three focused sections, you will explore everything from the basics to advanced concepts. Start with understanding what thermal management is and why it’s so important. Discover the key parts and heat sources in vehicles, and how different coolant types work to keep things running smoothly. Then dive deeper into individual cooling loops for different vehicle systems—how they work when the vehicle is idling, charging, braking, or driving. Learn how heating and air conditioning systems are integrated to keep comfort and safety in balance.
Finally, experience how all these pieces come together in an integrated thermal management system that keeps vehicles performing at their best in every situation, from parking to fast charging and heavy braking.
This course is perfect for engineers, students, or anyone passionate about the future of mobility. By the end, you’ll not only understand the science behind thermal management but also be ready to apply this knowledge in real-world vehicle design and troubleshooting.
Step into the future of vehicle technology — enroll today and become a thermal management pro!

requirements: No prior experience is required
Any AUTOCAD version from 2010 upwards will work well though the course was recorded with version 2021
A willingness and Patience to learn more than just the basics.
courses.description:
THE PROBLEM
Often times than not, A lot of beginners have always wanted to learn AutoCAD someway somehow, A lot of people can also use the basic skills of AUTOCAD but can't apply it to real world drawings. The use of AutoCAD is not restricted to drawing lines alone and that is the challenge this course has come to solve. Step up from your comfort of knowing only how to use AutoCAD LINES and COPY commands. This is the only course you need as a beginner to be able to take up drawing projects on your own. Intermediate users can also benefit from this course as it will give you an insight on how you can bring all the tools you have learnt into a real world drawing.


THE SOLUTION
The main aim of learning AutoCAD is in its application and as beginners to this course you will not only be able to use the basic tools of AutoCAD comfortably, also you will be able to prepare full construction drawings for clients and even make money from it.
THE SKILLS
1. Drawing of FLOOR PLANS
In this section you will learn how to draw basic and complex floor plans, you will also be able to dimension it thoroughly, also we will add various blocks like furniture's, gadgets, toilet fittings, cars into the drawing to make it more detailed. We will go through floor plans for a bungalow building and that of a storey building with two floors.
2. Drawing of ROOF PLANS
After completing the floor plans we will move to the roof plan and in this section we will learn how to generate both a basic roof plan and a complex one. This is an exciting section for all.
3. Drawing of ELEVATIONS
In this section, we will generate the elevations of each building we are working on making i.e. four in total per drawing. we will learn how to draw the elevations of roofs using the wooden fascia board style and the modern concrete fascia style, we will also beatify our elevations.
4. Drawing of SECTIONS
We will learn how to section the buildings along the x and y directions including the roof. This will then lead us to components of a roof truss of which a lecture has been dedicated too. This will also cover how we can section our staircases and foundations.
5. Drawing and Planning of STAIRCASE
As a designer, it is up to you to plan each and every aspect of a building including the staircase and that is where this section comes in handy. you will be exposed to the various components of a staircase and how they interact with all other building components. This is a very handy tool for everyone. So if you have always being intimidated by staircases this section will help kill you fear.
6. Plotting of SURVEY PLANS
Usually before any construction the land to build upon must be available and the land surveyors will go to the site to see the extent of the land that is available for use. This is usually shown on a survey plan or a lot plan. This piece of document is what is handed over to the designer (architect or engineer) as the case maybe and it is your duty to come up with a building that will suit the available land space. We will learn how to plot this piece of drawing in AUTOCAD and in turn use it to develop our site plan/landscaping
7. PRINTING
A usual neglect of most random tutorials online, this is the final section where we are going to learn how we can put all our drawings together in sheets and title block and go for printing. I urge you on getting to this section to endeavor to print your work on paper because some errors are better visualized on paper than on the screen.
***WHAT YOU GET***
A Full section dedicated to all beginners starting from an introduction to the UI of AUTOCAD
Comprehensive 118 Video Lectures (15hrs in Total)
Access to all drawing files and blocks for students use
Quizzes and lots more
Active Q&A support
All the knowledge to draw for people and make money or take up jobs as a Designer
Access to future updates
Work on real life drawings that will make your own projects easier
Remember
TO BE MORE IS TO KNOW MORE, AND TO KNOW MORE IS TO DRAW MORE
Why wait? Every day is a missed opportunity.
Click the “Buy Now” button and become a part of this comprehensive training.
target_audience: Beginners who know nothing about AUTOCAD and Building Construction Drawing

Architects, Building Technologists, Surveyors, Civil Engineers and all other professionals and students in the AEC Industry
Anyone who is willing to learn and take up jobs by preparing a full building construction drawing for clients

courses.title: AZ-900 Microsoft Azure Fundamentals Course & 2 Mock Exams
courses.bio: Pass AZ-900 Microsoft Azure Fundamentals in a WEEKEND. GET AZ- 900 Certification - Learn Azure Concepts.
objectives: This course covers every concepts to Pass Microsoft Azure Fundamentals Exam

Learn and Clear AZ-900 Microsoft Azure Fundamentals Certification exam confidently and Learn the AZURE Fundamentals
Have some labs and Real world Examples
requirements: No IT prerequisites required
courses.description:
Only AZ-900 Microsoft Azure Fundamentals course that you need. The AZ-900 Microsoft Azure Fundamentals course is an entry-level training program designed for anyone who are new to cloud computing and Microsoft Azure. It provides a broad understanding of core cloud concepts, Azure services, pricing models, security, compliance, and governance. This course serves as the perfect starting point for anyone looking to explore a career in cloud technology or seeking foundational knowledge before pursuing more advanced Azure certifications.
The course begins by introducing the basic principles of cloud computing, including the benefits of cloud adoption such as scalability, reliability, high availability, and cost-effectiveness. You will gain a clear understanding of different types of cloud models—public, private, and hybrid—as well as service models like Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS). This foundation sets the stage for understanding how Azure delivers these capabilities.
You will then dive into the core services and architecture of Microsoft Azure. The course explores fundamental Azure services including compute (Azure Virtual Machines, App Services), networking (Virtual Networks, Load Balancers), storage (Blob, File, and Disk Storage), and databases (Azure SQL Database, Cosmos DB). It also introduces tools for managing Azure resources, such as the Azure portal, Azure CLI, and Azure Resource Manager templates.
By the end of the course, You will be prepared to take the AZ-900 certification exam, which validates their foundational knowledge of Azure and cloud services. This course lays the groundwork for further Azure certifications and a successful journey into cloud computing.
target_audience: This Microsoft Azure Fundamentals course is for anyone wanting to obtain the knowledge to pass the AZ-900 Microsoft Azure Fundamentals Certification

courses.bio: Sprinkler System Design, Hydraulic Calculation, NFPA 13, BIM Coordination, Pipe Supports, Clash Detection In Revit 2026
objectives: Sprinkler System Layout in Revit MEP – Step-by-step workflow with expert spacing rules

Sprinkler Pipe Supports In Revit – Pract: Sprinkler Hanger & Support Modeling In Revit – Support Placement

requirements: Basic familiarity with the Revit interface
courses.description:
Note: This course goes beyond basic Revit commands. You will model and calculate sprinkler systems in Revit using a custom template and families, with full NFPA 13 alignment and no plugins. Based on real MEP projects, you will create print-ready deliverables and ensure smooth BIM coordination.


Key questions this course will answer:


What is the difference between someone who only places sprinkler symbols and a fire protection designer who performs hydraulic calculations, applies NFPA 13 spacing, and manages coordination directly in Revit?
How can hazard groups, obstruction rules, design density, and area of operation in Sprinkler System in Revit reduce redesigns and improve installation accuracy?
What skills are required to produce hydraulic reports, pipe sizing, hanger modeling, and clash detection in Revit (no plugins) at a professional level?


In SPRINKLER, you will work through a real project from template setup to layout, hydraulic calculation, reports and schedules, and BIM coordination. Everything is done in Revit—from pipe routing and slopes to pipe supports and hangers, and clash detection with architectural and structural models. The goal is to give you a project-ready, NFPA 13–aligned workflow that produces deliverables ready for submission, without extra software, and compatible with Revit 2020 and later.

Headlines:
Sprinkler System Layout In Revit - Step-By-Step, Expert Spacing
NFPA 13 Hazard Groups In Revit MEP - Clear Rules, Confident Decisions
Hydraulic Calculation In Revit - Complete Flow Paths & Pressure Loss
Area Analysis & Design Density In Revit - Accurate, Job-Ready Method
Pipe Routing & Slope Control In Revit - Professional, Clash-Wise Modeling
Pipe Size Optimization In Revit - Performance-Driven, Efficient Results
Sprinkler Head Placement In Revit - High-Detail, Obstruction-Aware Layouts
NFPA 13 Reports & Schedules In Revit - Clean, Ready-To-Deliver Docs
BIM/MEP Coordination In Revit - 3D Alignment With Structure & MEP
Clash Detection In Revit - Early Conflicts, Faster Rework Reduction
Pipe Supports & Hangers In Revit - Practical, Site-Ready Modeling
Template, Model Linking & Parameters In Revit - No Plugins, Speed & Consistency


Enroll in this course today to develop a professional, proven workflow for Sprinkler Systems in Revit and deliver high-quality project outputs.
Ask any question at any time—with 24/7 support, you will have guidance to quickly grow your fire protection design skills and be ready for real-world projects.

courses.title: Presentations for Architecture Project Boards
courses.bio: Craft Boards That Tell the Story of Your Architecture
objectives: Understand the purpose and power of project boards.
Choose and develop a visual style that fits your project.
Structure and compose boards that communicate ideas clearly.
Use layout, graphics, balance, and storytelling as key presentation tools.
Avoid common mistakes and elevate the emotional impact of your presentation.
requirements: No requirements.
courses.description:
We’ve all been there—you spend weeks on a project, the concept is solid, the work is strong… and then comes the presentation. Suddenly, the ideas feel flat on the board. The layout is rushed. The visuals don’t reflect the depth of your design. And no matter how much effort you put in, the message gets lost.
That’s exactly why this course exists.
“Presentations for Architecture Project Boards” is a step-by-step guide to creating boards that don’t just show your project but they communicate its value. Designed for students, young architects, and designers who want their work to make an impact, this course helps you craft boards that are clear, beautiful, and powerful.
You’ll learn how to tell the story of your project visually, how to build structure and flow across a board, and how to use style, composition, color, and graphic language to guide your viewer’s eye. Each lesson focuses on practical tools—like how to use contrast without chaos, or how to choose what not to include—and helps you develop your own visual voice.
Whether you’re preparing for a jury, presenting to clients, or submitting to a competition, this course will change how you think about boards forever.
By the end, you’ll feel confident walking into any review, knowing your board is doing half the talking for you. And more importantly—you’ll start enjoying the process of presenting your work.
I invite all students to ask questions or submit their work here, and I will be happy to provide inspirational feedback and engage one-on-one with each of you to help you bring it one step further and uncover your hidden potential.
target_audience: Architecture and Interior Design Students and Junior Professionals

Discover the art and science of crafting spaces that align with our natural rhythms. Our course, "Circadian Lighting Design: A Human-Centric Approach," guides you through the intricacies of creating indoor environments that not only illuminate but also enhance circadian health.
Dive deep into the core principles essential for designing spaces that foster well-being by adhering to circadian-friendly practices. This course offers you a comprehensive exploration of both the theoretical foundations and practical applications of circadian lighting design.
You will go over the current metrics for measuring the melanopic levels and circadian stimulus, and how to assess them with your lighting  calculation software.

courses.description:

In addition to framing options I will get into insulation types, pros/cons and tiny house specific considerations and suggestions when it comes to moisture protection, fasteners, attaching to your foundation and more. This will MOSTLY focus on tiny houses on wheels. I also hope to give you a basic understanding of tools needed for the task and important safety info!

This course is formatted to provide the information relevant to you and enable you to make the best decision for yourself. If you are excited about tiny houses and how they may empower you this course is for you!

courses.title: Net Zero Now
courses.bio: Sustainable Strategies for Modern Construction
objectives: Understand the core concepts of net zero, carbon neutrality, and decarbonization
Apply practical strategies to achieve net zero energy
Explore the environmental importance of net zero design
Integrate sustainability principles into architectural projects
requirements: This course is designed for anyone with a basic understanding of architectural design and an interest in sustainability. No prior knowledge of net zero, carbon neutrality, or energy modeling is required—key concepts will be clearly explained throughout. While some familiarity with building systems or sustainable design is helpful, the course is beginner-friendly and accessible. Optional access to design tools like CAD, Revit, or SketchUp may enhance your learning but is not mandatory.
courses.description:
Welcome to the cutting edge of sustainable architecture, where innovation meets environmental responsibility. Are you passionate about designing buildings that are not only stunning but also help create a greener, more sustainable world? Curious about how to achieve net zero energy in your projects or why net zero matters for the planet? This course is your comprehensive introduction to transforming those questions into actionable design strategies.
I’m Branka Knezevic, architect and founder of Plana Architects in Los Angeles, where sustainability drives every decision. In this course, I’ll guide you through the core principles of net zero architecture — moving beyond simple energy efficiency to a holistic, transformative approach. You’ll gain a deep understanding of essential concepts like decarbonization, net zero, and carbon neutrality, empowering you to design with purpose and impact.
Together, we’ll explore practical methods to implement net zero strategies in both new constructions and retrofitting existing buildings. You’ll discover how to create energy-efficient homes, workplaces, and even entire communities that reduce carbon footprints and promote environmental stewardship. This course breaks down complex ideas into accessible lessons, making sustainable design achievable for architects, designers, and enthusiasts alike.
Whether you’re looking to elevate your professional skills or embrace sustainable living, this course offers the knowledge and tools to lead the green building revolution. Prepare to challenge conventional architectural thinking and lay the foundation for a responsible, resilient built environment.
Join me on this inspiring journey to net zero excellence — where your vision meets a sustainable future. Let’s build a better world, one design at a time!
target_audience: This course is ideal for architects, designers, students, and sustainability enthusiasts who want to deepen their understanding of net zero design and its role in shaping a greener built environment. Whether you're early in your career, running your own firm, or simply passionate about sustainable architecture, this course will equip you with practical strategies and foundational knowledge to integrate net zero principles into your projects. It's also a great fit for professionals looking to future-proof their practice and align with evolving environmental standards.

General Notes are very important but yet not too many people know how to read or interpret these essential and helpful documents. I will go through a Standard General Note explaining it and discussing the meanings and use of this note to help you understand General Notes in Structural Drawings.


This course will not only help you to read and draw the structural drawings but will also help you to understand how actually the reinforcement is placed at the site. It will thus, help you prepare the bar bending schedules, give cutting length to the workers, and also prepare running and the final bills. Not only this, if you are a structural designer and want to learn the detailing of structural members, it will also help you to understand the concept of detailing and prepare the detailed drawings after you do the structural analysis and Design.


Practice Drawings:


The Practice Drawings are of a Real Project so you will be able to understand the real work as well but since this is a course for learning and for client disclosure the calculations used in this course are solely for learning purposes.


Prerequisites:


There are no prerequisites for those who want to learn how to read and interpret Structural Drawings.
For those who want to learn Structural Detailing in AutoCAD, the prerequisite is The Complete AutoCAD Course which you will find on my Instructor page or a Basic Knowledge of AutoCAD Software equivalent to the syllabus of The Complete AutoCAD Course.
target_audience: Civil Engineering Graduates who are currently working in the field of construction
Civil Engineers who need to work at construction sites and handle drawings
Structural designers who want to learn how to detail the structural members
